title: @Riot Is Elderwood Leblanc at all inspired by Midsummer Night's Dream?

embed.description: With today's update we kick off the 6.5 PBE cycle! In addition to a slew of tentative balance changes, today's update includes a new Elderwood LeBlanc skin, the crafting system exclusive Hextech Annie skin, new ability icons for Cho'Gath, and more! Continue reading for more information!

body: As a huge fan and scholar of Shakespeare, I can't help but feel that the skin, especially with it being described as a "trickster fairy" reimagining of Leblanc, is somehow related to Puck or the other mischievous fairies in English folklore.  I am in love with the visuals and will definitely be picking this skin up either way, I was just curious as to where the inspirations for it comes from.  Leblanc is a perfect candidate for a Puck skin, being the mischievous and deceptive person she is, so I also wanted to thank you for making this wonderful work of art!

replies.body:
We were inspired by a fan concept by [Mist XG](https://www.artstation.com/artist/z361474408) to explore a druidic/fairy space for LeBlanc. We ended up moving away from the Druidic aspect as it doesn't fit her character as well as the Faerie Trickster archetype. Some references I was inspired by were Titania from A Midsummer Night's Dream, Oona from MtG, Pan's Labyrinth, Penny Arcade's Thornwatch (Hecarim was influenced by this one too), young Maleficent in Maleficent (again Hecarim too) and the Sylvari from Guild Wars. LeBlanc was designed about the same time as Hecarim, after we fell in love with the Bard skin we wanted to expand the Elderwood (and you can probably find some of my player-probing in old threads), and they were designed with a greater story setting in mind;

In the core LoL lore LeBlanc is a schemer manipulating things from behind the scenes - so too in the Elderwood. I see Bard and his Meeplets as her emissary, reporting to her on the movement of intruders to their magical realm. While Hecarim is an ancient and powerful enforcer, protecting the forest from all who dare trespass. It was important for us to establish the Elderwood as a place were humans dare not go, for the magical forest is filled with powerful magical protectors. For this reason I tried to design LeBlanc as a fusion of both fae, animal and plant elements to emphasise that she is a creature of pure magic that simply _looks_ like the forest she is the embodiment of. Bard has coloured cloth and Hecarim has hewn stone that hint at Elven crafts from a forgotten time, but LeBlanc is pure forest magic!

To that point I think that it's also important that we push the breadth of design in our skin lines so that each champion brings something new to the setting. I've seen some beautiful fan concepts for possible Elderwood skins but they reuse too many elements from previous designs - in my mind these worlds are large and aside from specific cases such as Warden/Marauder I think each one is an opportunity to see something that combines some familiar motifs with something fresh.

Thanks so much for playing League of Legends and it really warms my heart to hear that players are enjoying this one. Working on this skin was something really special for me >:)

Will we reach a point where we will have truly official Lore for skin lines?

There are often threads like this one where the skin team talk about the story behind a skin line (I remember a really cool one about the Rogue Slaughter Fleet with Garen, Quinn, etc.), but it's very little compared to the core Lore.

On the other hand, I wouldn't want these side lores to detract from and slow down the core Lore. Damn, it's hard to chose... x)

I think that's precisely where our thinking is at. We want to focus on developing the core lore of LoL as there is still so much to be resolved right now!

Some time in the future though I'd love to do short stories or something with themes like PROJECT and Elderwood >xD
I think we all know who needs a Great Deku Tree skin.

Pretty sure it's Xerath.

"Guys, I've been standing here so long farming with Q that I've become a tree!"
I mean, if you really want to... you guys are Riot, after all.

Elderwood is one of my favorite skin lines! Thank you so much for responding to my feedback. I really enjoy noticing things and inspirations for things like that!  There are so many pieces to an enchanted forest: the insects, the flora, magical mushrooms, forests in the fall, hidden caves and dark and scary underbrush and what lurks below the canopy that blocks out the mundane world! Elderwood is definitely a skin line I could see with a lot of varying, yet still cohesive skins.  There is so much room to play and I can't wait to see what your talented artists come up with.  I really enjoy that Mist XG person's art and hope you pull from more of the various fan artists.  I have no talent for visual art, but I do enjoy writing.  Again thanks for your time, and keep up the amazing work in creating this wonderful game. :)

Since the skin is not finalized, could we maybe have that awesome fluttering animation on her W be her 'run fast' animation! The animation team put a bunch of work into a flutter on her W that you can barely see for half a second! It would be an awesome addition and would more than likely just be a recycled animation <3

Cool to hear! :) Elderwood is a cool theme; i don't play Hecarim but that's a boss skin. I also like to hear about the stories/worlds behind skin lines like this, such as with the Slaughter Fleet.

I was partially convinced that this LB skin was inspired by Rosine from Berserk, but it sounds like there's lots of other fantasy characters with a similar theme :P

Hello! Elderwood LB most definitely references A Midsummer Night's Dream - more specifically, Titania! The amazing concept artist, Kindlejack, created her :)
She is also based a bit on the more tricky European fairies, rather than the more benevolent ones!

I am so definitely getting this skin! Thank you for the comment! :) I figured it was one of them, but the phrase trickster fairy instantly made me think of Puck.  I can totally see Titania too. I am in love with this skin! More Shakespearean inspired skins please (Romeo and Juliet Kat and Garen?)! I think fairies are usually less benevolent than we'd like to believe, they are pretty devious little things haha
Immediate buy. Waiting for it to come out.
Hey Phog Christoph, I'm also a Shakespeare scholar! As you can see, it's influenced my summoner name.

That's an amazing name! I feel like poisoning Mac N Cheese would be a great way to kill someone in a modern Shakespearean Tragedy.  At least, if your target was me, I love Mac N Cheese as much as Desdemona loved Othello.{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
